meanings.definition: To fall or slip out of place
meanings.sent1: The bookshelf was prolapsing under the weight of the heavy books.
meanings.sent2: The loose shoelace kept prolapsing, causing the person to trip.
meanings.sent3: The tower of cards prolapsing unexpectedly startled everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence started prolapsing like a deflating balloon.
meanings.sent5: The melting ice cream was prolapsing down the cone, creating a sticky mess.

meanings.definition: The condition of an organ or part of the body slipping out of its normal position
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with a severe case of intestinal prolapsing.
meanings.sent2: The weightlifter experienced a painful prolapsing of his hernia during the competition.
meanings.sent3: The comical scene in the movie involved a character's exaggerated prolapsing of a fake nose.
meanings.sent4: In her dream, the cityscape had a surreal prolapsing of buildings into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake caused a frightening prolapsing of the ground beneath their feet.
